utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: To Farrah, may the greatest mysteries of your life lie ahead. Richard Castle.

utterance.speaker: FARRAH DARWAZA
utterance.content: Thank you so much. You know, our pilot is also a huge fan. You think you could sign a book for her, too?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’d love to. All I ask in return is that she deliver us to Heathrow safely.

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: Hey! Hey!

utterance.speaker: FARRAH
utterance.content: Um, enjoy your stay in London, Mr. Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: I got bumped out of my assigned seat. You said you’d fix it.

utterance.speaker: FARRAH
utterance.content: I said you had my apology. This is the only seat available in first.

utterance.speaker: MAN
utterance.content: Do you know who I am?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know who he is but I know what he is. A giant ass – whoa!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, when did you become such a nervous flyer?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m not. I just don’t like turbulence. Or a sudden drop in cabin pressure. Or mechanical problems. Or crashing.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: There’s nothing to worry about. It’s just a little bumpy air, that’s all it is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Air, by nature, should not be bumpy.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Just look at the flight crew. If they’re up and smiling then everything’s fine.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, well, they’re up but they are not exactly smiling.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, it’s a long flight. You should really focus on something else or it’ll seem even longer. For both of us.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Fine. I shall ignore the grim specter of death and focus on our itinerary. All right. A car is going to pick us up from the hotel, whisk us off to the Sherlock Holmes Society, where I will speak to my fellow mystery writers about –

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Actually, I made plans for tonight.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wh – what plans? With who?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Oh, some friends who are doing their semester abroad in London. We’re meeting at a pub in South Kent.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But the um – the Sherlock Holmes Society is convening at 221B Baker Street. You don’t want to miss the actual home of Sherlock Holmes!

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You do know he’s fictional, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, but his address is real. And I will be speaking and if you are not there who will be proud of me?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I’m always proud of you, Dad. But I’ve heard you speak a million times. I know what you’re going to say.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That is improbable.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You’ll say you don’t believe in writer’s block. That you wrote your first novel to impress a girl. That reading great writers inspires you and drinking with them inspires you to beat them on the best seller list.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. Clearly I need to develop some new material. But this was supposed to be old-fashioned father/daughter time.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, watching you speak to your cronies isn’t exactly father/daughter time. Besides, I’m not twelve. We don’t have to be attached at the hip.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. That impending specter of death? It’s back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. Beckett! How did you get in there?

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Through the magic of Wi-Fi. I figured you’d be online. So I thought that you would want an update. We solved the case. The racecar driver did it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah. That’s good to hear.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is everything okay up there?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Just a little turbulence.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, is something wrong?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Everything’s going to be just fine.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, Castle.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle? Is it just me or does everything not seem just fine?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Beckett, relax. Even the most heinous turbulence won’t bring a plane down.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: And every day twenty flights leave New York and land in London without a problem. It’s going to be the same for Castle’s flight, too.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s going to be all right.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN EDMUNDS
utterance.content: Folks, this is Captain Edmunds. We hit some chop there, but we’ve climbed to 39,000 feet and expect a smooth ride all the way to Heathrow.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: See? There’s nothing to worry about.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then why aren’t they smiling?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, you heard the pilot.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m telling you, something is not right. And I’m going to find out what.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Excuse me?

utterance.speaker: JIM KOGUT
utterance.content: Sir, the seatbelt sign is still illuminated. If you could please return to your seat –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re not smiling. None of you are smiling, and the Captain’s here? What’s going on? Is there some sort of mechanical problem?

utterance.speaker: JIM
utterance.content: Please, sir, just return –

utterance.speaker: FARRAH
utterance.content: Jim, wait. Maybe he can help.

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN EDMUNDS
utterance.content: Mr. Castle, I’m Captain Edmunds. You work with the NYPD, right? We could actually use your assistance.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: My assistance with what?

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN EDMUNDS
utterance.content: This is Kyle Ford. He’s the air marshal on this flight.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I saw this guy. He’s sitting in my row. He – – at least, he was sitting in my row. What does this have to do with the air marshal?

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN EDMUNDS
utterance.content: An hour ago he sent a text to his field office about a security issue on board this aircraft.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What kind of security issue?

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN EDMUNDS
utterance.content: “Possible threat to Oceanic Air Flight 57. I’m investigating.” That’s all Ford said in his text.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And what did he tell you?

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN EDMUNDS
utterance.content: Unfortunately I haven’t been able to talk to him. Mr. Ford is missing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Missing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Missing? How could he be missing? Did you search the plane?

utterance.speaker: DEBBIE PARKER
utterance.content: From front to back.

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN EDMUNDS
utterance.content: Given the circumstances, I’ve been instructed to lock myself in the cockpit and continue on to Heathrow.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Terrorism protocol?

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN EDMUNDS
utterance.content: Precisely. Right now, with the air marshal unaccounted for, you’re the closest thing we have to law enforcement on this plane.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which in itself is cause for concern.

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN EDMUNDS
utterance.content: Will you help us, Mr. Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Yes. No, of course. Of course. Okay, um … when you searched the plane where did you look?

utterance.speaker: FARRAH
utterance.content: Um, the restrooms, the galleys –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Good.

utterance.speaker: JIM
utterance.content: The cargo hold.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Great.

utterance.speaker: JIM
utterance.content: Even the overhead bins.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. Well, Mr. Ford is on the plane somewhere. We just have to search again. Maybe skip the overhead bins this time.

utterance.speaker: DEBBIE
utterance.content: I don’t know. It’s like he just disappeared. It doesn’t make sense. Excuse me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How well do you know the air marshal?

utterance.speaker: DEBBIE
utterance.content: Not that well. Mr. Ford flies with us, like, twice a month. He’s very professional, very polite. There you go.

utterance.speaker: DEBBIE
utterance.content: Okay. This is the only other place we haven’t given a second look.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Does Ford know how to get down here?

utterance.speaker: DEBBIE
utterance.content: Of course. He has access to the entire plane, just like we do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It runs the length of the plane. And you looked everywhere?

utterance.speaker: DEBBIE
utterance.content: Well, we didn’t pull out all the luggage because there was no sign anyone was down here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s a snake on the motherflying plane!

utterance.speaker: DEBBIE
utterance.content: You’re lucky it wasn’t the pit bulls we had to ship last week.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look at this luggage. Since when does the airline allow clothes hanging out of bags?

utterance.speaker: DEBBIE
utterance.content: They don’t. Not usually.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s three different bags from three different passengers. That doesn’t make any sense. Unless …

utterance.speaker: DEBBIE
utterance.content: Unless what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Unless someone took the clothes out of another suitcase and stuffed them into those three bags.

utterance.speaker: DEBBIE
utterance.content: You don’t think …?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: One way to find out.

utterance.speaker: DEBBIE
utterance.content: Oh my God. That’s Air Marshal Ford.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’ve got to be kidding me. The air marshal is dead?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not just dead. But bumped on the head, murdered. And there’s more.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: There’s more?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Kyle Ford’s holster is empty. His gun is missing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so we have to assume that the killer is armed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And they may have another agenda: taking hostages, hijacking the plane. FYI – this is not the relaxing London getaway I had planned.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So who else knows about this?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, just the flight crew, the air marshal service, and the FBI.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And how can I help?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, they gave me a copy of the flight manifest. I emailed it to you. You should have it by now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Good. I’ll coordinate with the FBI and start running names to look for red flags. Are you okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Alexis is on this flight. Along with almost two hundred other people.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, you can do this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do what? What am I supposed to do? Catch the killer? It could be anyone. I wouldn’t know where to start.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You start at the beginning. We build a timeline for our victim, same first step we always take.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right. Right. Just, this time the first step is 39,000 feet off the ground.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, I’m going to be here with you. I’ll working this case from the ground, along with the boys.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. Thank you. I can figure this out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I know you can.

utterance.speaker: DEBBIE
utterance.content: I am sorry, miss. This area is off limits.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, she’s – that’s – she’s with me. That’s my daughter. She’s –

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You were gone so long I got worried. Why are you down here?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, I’ll call you later. I love you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I love you, too.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: - always rooting for that coyote, not that roadrunner.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Guys? I need your help.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Who do you think could have done it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, that’s what I’m going to try and figure out.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: How?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: By reconstructing Ford’s movements with the flight crew. In the meantime I need you to keep this to yourself and go back upstairs where it’s safer.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: How is it safer? Isn’t that where the killer is?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I – look, I just don’t want you to be a part of this.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I’m already a part of it. I can help, Dad. I interned with Lanie, remember? I’ll check the body for clues.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well – Alexis –

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: There’s a killer on this plane. We don’t know what he’s planning or who he is. And maybe I can do something about that. I am not going back to my seat.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Even if it means us being joined at the hip?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Really? You’re throwing that back at me now?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right in your face.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I’ll get started here. You go talk to the flight crew and try to figure out who did this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: JIM
utterance.content: It was someone out there. One of those people killed Kyle Ford.

utterance.speaker: FARRAH
utterance.content: I just told the other flight attendants. I still can’t believe this.

utterance.speaker: DEBBIE
utterance.content: What do we do now, Mr. Castle?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, now we try to piece together where the victim was and who he had contact with before he died. When was the last time anyone remembers seeing Air Marshal Ford?

utterance.speaker: FARRAH
utterance.content: Wait. Who served him during drink service?

utterance.speaker: DEBBIE
utterance.content: I did.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, this was an 8:30AM flight. Drink service occurred when?

utterance.speaker: DEBBIE
utterance.content: Uh, we start at 10.

utterance.speaker: FARRAH
utterance.content: And by the time I did the trash pickup Ford wasn’t in his seat. He was gone.

utterance.speaker: JIM
utterance.content: Not gone. I noticed him during meal service near the back of the plane.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Doing what?

utterance.speaker: JIM
utterance.content: I didn’t see because a passenger got in my face about the lousy food. We recently changed vendors to save money –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I – – when you saw him was he in aisle one or aisle two?

utterance.speaker: DEBBIE
utterance.content: If it was meal service, aisle one is blocked by the cart.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So aisle two. What time was that?

utterance.speaker: JIM
utterance.content: Just before 11.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And we found the body at 11:35, giving us about a 35 minute window before he was killed. Does anyone else remember seeing him in the back of the plane? Was he with someone?

utterance.speaker: DEBBIE
utterance.content: Come on, you guys. Try to remember.

utterance.speaker: FARRAH
utterance.content: Maybe we can ask the passengers in back if they saw him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, if we did that word would get out that something was wrong. Word that could make it back to the killer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe there’s another way to know what Ford was doing at the back of this aisle. How long have those two gentlemen been taking selfies?

utterance.speaker: JIM
utterance.content: The honeymooners? Since their first Pimm’s cup. They’re adorable.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I have to talk to them.

utterance.speaker: DEBBIE
utterance.content: What should we do?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You have the hardest job of all. Pretend like everything’s normal.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS
utterance.content: I think for the rest of the trip we should talk like this.

utterance.speaker: HUSBAND
utterance.content: So posh. How do you say selfie in British?

utterance.speaker: CHRIS
utterance.content: Selfie.

utterance.speaker: HUSBAND
utterance.content: Sophie?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why don’t’ I grab a proper picture of the two of you?

utterance.speaker: CHRIS
utterance.content: Oh! Great, thanks!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You bet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There we go.

utterance.speaker: HUSBAND
utterance.content: Can you hurry up? My face is hurting.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right. One more for safety.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So how did you guys meet?

utterance.speaker: CHRIS
utterance.content: It’s kind of a long story.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. Well, I love long stories.

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: It’s awful what you’re dealing with, sweetie.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Thanks for your help, Lanie.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Are you kidding? I just wish there was more I could do. I’m going to talk you through this, all right?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Do you want to see the head wound first?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Yeah. But you’re going to need to get in really close.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Try moving the hair back a little. Yeah, there we go.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Can you tell what he was hit with?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Mmm. It’s hard to say. Something oblong. A pipe, maybe.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Oh, man.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Alexis, are you all right? It’s just another body. You’ve done this plenty of times before.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: It’s not the body I’m worried about. It’s the person who killed him and took his gun.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: And looking at this, there is something I can tell you about who that person is.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You and Lanie find something?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: No signs of a struggle. But it looks like Ford died from a single blow to the back of the head. The left parietal bone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So the killer must have caught him by surprise.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: The bigger news is the angle of the blow indicates whoever did this was left handed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Statistically speaking, that rules out most everyone on the plane. Good work.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: The gay couple? Are they suspects?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nah, I really doubt it.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Then why do you have their selfies?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I emailed them to myself off their phone. That’s … a long story. Almost as long as the one about how they met. But they took these near the time Air Marshal Ford was at the back of the plane. I was hoping that he’d show up in one of them, along with the killer, but no luck.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Not even in the video?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Actually, I didn’t check out that one.

utterance.speaker: CHRIS
utterance.content: Hello!

utterance.speaker: HUSBAND
utterance.content: Hello!

utterance.speaker: CHRIS
utterance.content: We did it!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: In the background. There he is. There’s Ford.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: But he’s not with anybody. He was checking the overhead bin.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, but for what? Not his own bag. He was up here in first with us.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Let’s play it again.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe something’s in there? Ford said he was on to a possible threat.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: But he’s not even looking inside.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because the overhead bin is a ruse. See how Ford is glancing over his shoulder? He’s clocking someone.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You’re right. It’s this guy. 26B. And look. He realizes Ford is watching him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: 26B … 26B. Isadore Baldon.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Isadore Baldon, 25, of Brooklyn. No criminal record, but … we have a problem, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s the problem?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He doesn’t match the man you described. We contacted Baldon. He’s actually here, in town. His passport was stolen weeks ago. Whoever’s sitting in 26B, it’s not Isadore Baldon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, maybe that’s why Ford was watching him. He got on to that somehow.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And then moments later Ford was murdered.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think we found our killer.

utterance.speaker: FARRAH
utterance.content: What’s he doing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sweating bullets. He’s nervous.

utterance.speaker: JIM
utterance.content: Of course he’s nervous. He just killed Kyle Ford.

utterance.speaker: FARRAH
utterance.content: We don’t know that, Jim.

utterance.speaker: JIM
utterance.content: He’s flying on a stolen passport. He requested a seat in the back, near the cargo hold. You saw the video. Ford was watching him and now he’s dead. Debbie, you can’t tell me he doesn’t meet the criteria for posing a threat to passengers and crew.

utterance.speaker: DEBBIE
utterance.content: No, he definitely does. Under the circumstances we’re empowered to detain him. And we have the training to do so.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t think you should. Not just yet.

utterance.speaker: DEBBIE
utterance.content: Well, you’re not responsible for the people on this plane. We are.

utterance.speaker: FARRAH
utterance.content: Yeah. And if he did it, he has a gun.

utterance.speaker: JIM
utterance.content: And I, for one, don’t want to wait for him to start shooting it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And what if he’s not our guy? You go out there and take him down it’ll start a panic, alert the real killer, and he may pull a gun anyway.

utterance.speaker: DEBBIE
utterance.content: Okay. So what do you propose?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We need to identify him. Figure out who it is we’re dealing with. Isn’t it about time for another drink service?

utterance.speaker: JIM
utterance.content: It would be, except for that the airlines cut back so now we’re only allowed -

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Jim. Jim. My treat.

utterance.speaker: FARRAH
utterance.content: Trash. Thank you. Thank you very much.

utterance.speaker: FARRAH
utterance.content: Can I take that for you, sir?

utterance.speaker: FARRAH
utterance.content: Thank you so much.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well played, Farrah.

utterance.speaker: FARRAH
utterance.content: What are we doing now?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: He’s using the graphite from his mechanical pencil to make fingerprint powder.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I saw this on MacGyver once. You know, I actually met Richard Dean Anderson. You know what he said –

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Can you please do it already?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: FARRAH
utterance.content: It’s actually working.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sweet.

utterance.speaker: TORY ELLIS
utterance.content: I got a hit off the FBI database.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Aiman Haddad.

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: He’s a Syrian national in the US on a student visa. Enrolled at Hudson University. 24 years old.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait, if he’s here legally then why would he be travelling on a stolen passport?

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: It might be because the FBI has him on the no-fly list.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: For what reason?

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: Apparently Aiman Haddad is affiliated with ISIS.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s a terrorist?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It gets worse. I just talked to Haddad’s roommate at Hudson. He said that Haddad had recently become super religious and sold all his stuff, and when the roommate asked why, Haddad said that he wasn’t going to be needing it anymore.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We gotta tell Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Thank you for letting me know. I’ll call you later.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What is it? What did Beckett say?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I want you to go back to first class. Stay there until I tell you.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Be careful, Dad.

utterance.speaker: DEBBIE
utterance.content: I take it he’s a bad guy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s on the no-fly list and for good reason.

utterance.speaker: JIM
utterance.content: So he’s a terrorist?

utterance.speaker: FARRAH
utterance.content: Oh my God.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He murdered the air marshal. Now that is a bold act committed by someone not concerned what happens to him once the plane lands.

utterance.speaker: JIM
utterance.content: Because maybe the plane won’t be landing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think we can assume the worst. Assume that his plan is bigger than killing Kyle Ford.

utterance.speaker: DEBBIE
utterance.content: Okay, we know what to do. First, we isolate him if possible –

utterance.speaker: JIM
utterance.content: I’ll control his hands so he doesn’t go for the gun or … something worse.

utterance.speaker: FARRAH
utterance.content: I’ll get the zip ties to secure him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Good. And like you said, I think we should do this quietly. Try to get him out of his seat and away from the other passengers.

utterance.speaker: DEBBIE
utterance.content: I could page him back to the rear galley.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, then he might get suspicious. That’s too risky. If he realizes we’re trying to take him down he may do something desperate.

utterance.speaker: MARILYN
utterance.content: Hey, what are you doing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Open the door! Open the door.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Can you understand what he’s saying?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who is it? Who are you talking to?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What are you saying? What was he saying?

utterance.speaker: FARRAH
utterance.content: He said "they know" and "it’ll all be over soon".

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo, Beckett. Just got off with Homeland Security. The number that Haddad was calling was traced to a Syrian mobile account.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, did you hear that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Do we know who he was calling?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. State’s trying to coordinate with the Syrian government, but they’re not expecting any sort of cooperation.

utterance.speaker: AIMAN HADDAD
utterance.content: You are making a mistake! I have rights!

utterance.speaker: DEBBIE
utterance.content: Okay, we checked his seat and his carryon and there’s no sign of a gun.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett, we can’t find the gun.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, he might have hidden it somewhere. Or he has a partner who’s on board. Either way, Castle, you’re going to have to interrogate him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’ve been with me in hundreds of interrogations.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, just never when my life depended on it … along with everyone else’s.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey guys? I have more bad news. According to the airline, Haddad has a checked bag on the flight. FBI needs you to locate and search it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Great. And if we find something?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: In the event there’s an explosive device the bomb squad will walk you through it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We need to find his luggage.

utterance.speaker: JIM
utterance.content: I’ll go with you.

utterance.speaker: DEBBIE
utterance.content: No, no, no. I need you and Farrah upstairs keeping things calm. The passengers are starting to ask questions.

utterance.speaker: JIM
utterance.content: What did you tell them?

utterance.speaker: DEBBIE
utterance.content: That an gentleman had too much to drink, but I’m not sure they believed me.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I’ll go. The faster we find it the safer we’ll be.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right. Wish me luck.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You don’t need it. You’ve done this a million times.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’ll let you know if I find anything.

utterance.speaker: HADDAD
utterance.content: Please. This is all a terrible mistake.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s your name?

utterance.speaker: HADDAD
utterance.content: Isadore Baldon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe we should try this again. We know you are Aiman Haddad and that you have ties with ISIS. Now, what is you plan and who are you working with?

utterance.speaker: HADDAD
utterance.content: I don’t know what you’re talking about.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: “They know and it’ll all be over soon.” That’s what you said upstairs on the phone. Who were you talking to?

utterance.speaker: HADDAD
utterance.content: Why should I answer when I can see that you won’t believe me?

utterance.speaker: DEBBIE
utterance.content: Over here.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Anything like this ever happen on a flight before?

utterance.speaker: DEBBIE
utterance.content: Closest I came was a 90 year old who had a heart attack. Luckily that one had a happy ending.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: This one will, too. How long have you been doing this?

utterance.speaker: DEBBIE
utterance.content: Thirty years. Thought I’d seen it all. Every crazy passenger, every country, now this.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: If anyone can figure it out, my dad can.

utterance.speaker: DEBBIE
utterance.content: Good thing he’s on this flight. You’re lucky to have family like that.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah, I guess I am. What about you? You have kids?

utterance.speaker: DEBBIE
utterance.content: Ah… what can I say? I was always up in the air. Got it. Isadore Baldon. This is his bag.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Now, I’m not a cop. And I’m not an air marshal. But I’m going to find out what you’re up to. Do you know why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because my daughter is on this plane and I’m not going to let anything happen to her.

utterance.speaker: HADDAD
utterance.content: I am not a terrorist.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re on the no-fly list.

utterance.speaker: HADDAD
utterance.content: Only because my idiot cousin decided to join ISIS.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re flying on a stolen passport.

utterance.speaker: HADDAD
utterance.content: I couldn’t travel under my own name, so how else should I fly?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why the sudden urgency to fly in the first place?

utterance.speaker: HADDAD
utterance.content: I need to go back to Syria.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why? What’s your mission?

utterance.speaker: HADDAD
utterance.content: My mission? I have to go home. My mother is very sick. Pancreatic cancer. I petitioned the TSA. I went through the proper channels. But now she only has a few weeks to live. She is the one I was talking to on the phone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Explain this. See how the air marshal is staring right at you?

utterance.speaker: HADDAD
utterance.content: He’s the air marshal?

utterance.speaker: HADDAD
utterance.content: He saw I was nervous, didn’t he? Is he the reason I’m being detained?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, you might say that. He realized you were up to something so you followed him to the back of the plane and you killed him.

utterance.speaker: HADDAD
utterance.content: Killed him? What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We found him, right over there.

utterance.speaker: HADDAD
utterance.content: No. No. No, no, no, no, no. No, no. In fact, seconds after that this man got numerous texts on his phone and began texting back and then he rushed off. This is the last I saw of him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We have his phone, Haddad. He only sent one text.

utterance.speaker: HADDAD
utterance.content: No, I know what I saw. He got a bunch of texts. Five, at least.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad? Could I see you for a second?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Anything?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: We checked his luggage. No gun, no device, nothing that speaks to terrorism.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, State can’t confirm the story about the sick mother, but part of Haddad’s story checks out.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Turns out that Air Marshal Ford had a second phone on the flight.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It was his personal cell.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, we didn’t find a second phone on the body.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, if it had evidence on it it’s possible the killer removed it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Can we recover his texts without the phone?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, but it’s going to take some time to get the phone company to release them.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And time is something we don’t have.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And none of this clears Haddad. This could all be a smoke screen.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Something for us to chase while his real plan unfolds.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We need that phone. If Ford was texting then he must have been connected to the plane’s Wi-Fi.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Which means the phone may still be connected.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right. So can Tory ping his cell using the Find My Users app? Make it beep?

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: Okay, I’m in. I’ve linked his number into the app. Ready to ping when you are.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. Stand by. All right everyone. Ready?

utterance.speaker: DEBBIE
utterance.content: Ready. Farrah and I are in coach and Jim is in first class.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Watch for anyone reaching for their phone. Ford’s phone could be in the killer’s hands.

utterance.speaker: DEBBIE
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. Go.

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: Pinging now.

utterance.speaker: FARRAH
utterance.content: Over there. False alarm.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Do you hear anything?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: If someone removed the battery or even turned it off Tory’s not going to be able to –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I have something.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Where is it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, crap. I hate snakes. How long does it take a snake to pass a –

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: There it is!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, thank God.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s locked. We need his passcode.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Or his fingerprint.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I am so sorry about this. And thank you for your service to our country. Okay.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What’s it say?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s gotta be at least a dozen texts on here.

utterance.speaker: HADDAD
utterance.content: You see? I told you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: “Hey sexy, wanna have some fun?”

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: “Who is this?”

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: “Meet me in the back of the plane and you’ll find out.” But then when they refused to reveal their identity Ford won’t meet.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Look, the texts start to get hostile.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: “Do what I say or you’ll have a situation on your hands.”

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: “What kind of situation?”

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: “The kind you’re hired to prevent.”

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: “It’s a federal offense to threaten an aircraft.”

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: “It’s not a threat if I follow through and take down this plane.”

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Whoever's behind this is still on the plane.

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: Beckett, I’ve got something.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Hold on.

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: Those texts on the marshal’s phone, they were sent from a prepaid phone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can you trace it?

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: No, it looks like it’s been turned off.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, run down that number. See if you can find out who bought it and from where.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, you still there?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m here. Whoever’s behind this did their homework. They had Ford’s personal number and they knew exactly how to manipulate him. They must have known him somehow.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ve got the boys digging into Ford’s life. Financials, movements, phone records. They’re looking for anything that’ll connect him to someone on that flight.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, tell them to dig a little faster before our texter makes good on his threat to take us down.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, I –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know. Me too. Call me when you have something.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: We just can’t sit around and wait for word from the precinct. There has to be something we can do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, maybe there is. Only ten percent of the population is left handed. There must be a way for us to figure out who of the passengers is a southpaw, thus narrowing our suspect pool.

utterance.speaker: FARRAH
utterance.content: We could pass out customs and immigration forms. Then we’d know who’s left handed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Brilliant. Now you’re thinking like a mystery writer.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Think this will work?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know. It’s better than doing nothing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. Too bad we didn’t sleep through this, too.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m just making sure it’s still there.

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: Beckett, I got it. The phone that texted the marshal. The phone was purchased online and picked up at the airport at a Flight Tech Express store less than half an hour before the flight.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Does the store have any cameras?

utterance.speaker: TORY
utterance.content: No. And the cameras in the airport don’t have a good angle on the register. But we don’t need video. The purchaser used a credit card. We have her name. And I checked the manifest. She’s on the plane.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Marilyn Singer?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, she’s a former Oceanic executive who got fired last year. And Castle, get this. She filed a wrongful termination suit accusing the airline of blackballing her. And last week the judge ruled against her in favor of Oceanic Airlines.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So she wants to – – so she wants to take down one of their planes for revenge? That seems a little extreme.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, Castle. But it’s consistent with the texts she sent the air marshal. And what better way for her to destroy the airline she believes ruined her life?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What seat is she in?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: That’s Marilyn?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The hair, the glasses? She did not want to be recognized.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad. Left hand. It’s her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, we need to isolate her before she carries out whatever her plan is.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: How?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Go to your seat.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What are you going to do?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Something very stupid.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: She has a gun.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which is why I want you as far away as possible.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You know I feel the same way about you, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I do. I do. Now, go back to your seat. Please. I’m going to need a glass of wine. Red.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh! I am so sorry!

utterance.speaker: DEBBIE
utterance.content: My apologies, ma’am. I have stain remover in the galley. Come with me. We’ll clean you up.

utterance.speaker: MARILYN SINGER
utterance.content: Thank you, no. I’ve got detergent wipes in my bag.

utterance.speaker: DEBBIE
utterance.content: Ma’am, you don’t want that to set. Come back with me and we’ll take care of it.

utterance.speaker: MARILYN
utterance.content: Don’t touch me. I’m fine.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe you should go with her.

utterance.speaker: MARILYN
utterance.content: I said I’m fine.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Gun!

utterance.speaker: FARRAH
utterance.content: Ladies and gentlemen, please remain seated. We obviously had a situation, but we have it under control.

utterance.speaker: MARILYN
utterance.content: I’m telling you, this is some kind of mistake. That gun is not mine.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What was your plan, Marilyn? Take hostages? Try to bring down the plane?

utterance.speaker: MARILYN
utterance.content: Bring down the plane? What the hell are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m talking about the suit you lost against Oceanic. And the threatening texts you sent from this phone.

utterance.speaker: MARILYN
utterance.content: That is not my phone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It was in your purse. Paid for with your credit card.

utterance.speaker: MARILYN
utterance.content: Where’s Kyle? I want to talk to Kyle. I know he’s the air marshal on this flight. Did he put you up to this? Because it is not funny.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How is it that you know Mr. Ford?

utterance.speaker: MARILYN
utterance.content: He’s my boyfriend. All right? And if he thinks he’s teaching me a lesson I’m going to be seriously pissed. Now, where is he?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Marilyn. Kyle is dead.

utterance.speaker: MARILYN
utterance.content: Dead? Kyle’s dead? How?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You should know. His gun was in your purse.

utterance.speaker: MARILYN
utterance.content: No. I – I don’t understand what’s going on. Someone else must have put that in my bag with the phone when I was in the bathroom.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And I suppose you always wear a wig when you travel.

utterance.speaker: MARILYN
utterance.content: You don’t understand. I thought – I thought Kyle was having an affair. It was our six month anniversary and we were supposed to go away for the weekend. But at the last minute Kyle called and said that he had to work this flight. That he had to fill in for someone. But there was something in his voice. Like he wasn’t telling me the whole story.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you decided to stalk him? Follow him onto this plane.

utterance.speaker: MARILYN
utterance.content: We met in the air. Fell in love on the long haul. I thought maybe he’d found someone else.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is that why you lured him back here? To confront him? And when it all went south you killed him in a rage?

utterance.speaker: MARILYN
utterance.content: No. I wouldn’t do that. Please. You have to believe me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I can’t afford to. Jim, take her down below. Make sure she’s secure.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What’s wrong?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t know. Just – when I told her Ford was dead her reaction seemed … so real.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, the gun and phone were in her purse. She’s left handed. I –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, I know, I know. Everything fits. But why buy a prepaid phone online just to pick it up at the airport store minutes later? Why not just walk into the store and buy it? And why use a credit card? That can be traced back to her, unless … … unless that was part of the plan. To give us the perfect suspect so we’d stop looking for the truth.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You think someone set her up?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think something else is going on here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, Castle, you’ve been through a lot up there, so maybe your storyteller’s imagination is getting the best of you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m telling you, there’s a lot more going on here. Someone wants us to think that this is over. But it’s not.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Castle may be right.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We contacted the air marshal service. Ford wasn’t filling in for anyone. He requested to be on that flight.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We also double checked Ford’s financial records and we found a transaction that just posted. Turns out $9,950 was wired to his bank account just minutes before takeoff.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Just under the ten thousand dollar mark. Someone didn’t want to tip off the Feds.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Whatever’s going on up there, Ford is involved.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who’s the money from?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: This guy. Victor Christoph Dietrich. He’s a wealthy German industrialist. A big name in the import/export business. US Customs officials had flagged him several times for violations but nothing ever stuck.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Do you think Ford requested to be on this flight because Dietrich paid him to be on it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. But why?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where is Dietrich?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: His office is two blocks away.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I want him here. Now.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: VICTOR DIETRICH
utterance.content: I am sorry, Detectives, but I’ve never seen him before.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then why was $10,000 transferred from your bank account to his, Mr. Dietrich?

utterance.speaker: DIETRICH
utterance.content: Must be some kind of banking error.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, it’s not. Both of your financial institutions confirmed it.

utterance.speaker: DIETRICH
utterance.content: It isn’t a crime to give a gift.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, so it’s a gift, now? To someone that you don’t even know?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What were you paying the air marshal for, Mr. Dietrich?

utterance.speaker: DIETRICH
utterance.content: This has been delightful, but I’m afraid I have to go.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Um, no. You’re not going anywhere.

utterance.speaker: DIETRICH
utterance.content: You have no cause to hold me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Actually, we do. As a material witness.

utterance.speaker: DIETRICH
utterance.content: A witness to what?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The murder of a federal air marshal on a transatlantic flight.

utterance.speaker: DIETRICH
utterance.content: Murder? Air Marshal Ford is – is dead?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes. Now, what was the money for?

utterance.speaker: DIETRICH
utterance.content: Security.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What kind of security?

utterance.speaker: DIETRICH
utterance.content: I consult with Brampton’s Auction House. I hired Mr. Ford to provide protection for a piece we acquired from the Met that was … being transported on that plane.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What kind of a piece?

utterance.speaker: DIETRICH
utterance.content: It is an Art Deco era Louis Calliat Celestialis watch worth $13.3 million dollars.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And Ford was carrying it?

utterance.speaker: DIETRICH
utterance.content: He was merely keeping an eye on it. One of our in-house apprentices is actually wearing the timepiece.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You gave an apprentice a 13 million dollar watch?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s a common auction house practice. They fly an employee to a foreign country wearing the goods so that they don’t have to claim it or pay taxes on it.

utterance.speaker: DIETRICH
utterance.content: With such a valuable piece I wanted real security for the flight, and Ford was backing up my courier. That was all.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Except that wasn’t all. Something went awry.

utterance.speaker: DIETRICH
utterance.content: Yes. The courier stopped replying to my texts shortly after takeoff.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What was the courier’s name and where was he sitting?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Aaron Rich. Aaron, wake up. Hey. I think he’s been drugged. Wake up!

utterance.speaker: FARRAH
utterance.content: Mr. Castle, what are you doing?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: It’s part of the investigation.

utterance.speaker: FARRAH
utterance.content: The suspect is in custody.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Maybe not.

utterance.speaker: AARON
utterance.content: No! No, no, no. I wasn’t supposed to fall asleep. Thank God.

utterance.speaker: AARON
utterance.content: Hey. Hey! Hey, let go of me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Don’t thank God just yet. This watch is a fake. The real Celestialis is self-winding. This watch has a knob. Which mean this was never about terrorism. It was about a heist.

utterance.speaker: AARON
utterance.content: I don’t – I don’t understand.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re wearing a knockoff. It got switched out while you were sleeping. You weren’t supposed to realize it until you were off the plane and the real watch was long gone.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: That obnoxious guy who had his seat changed. Was this originally where he was supposed to sit?

utterance.speaker: FARRAH
utterance.content: Yes, but Mr. Ford put in a request for that seat two days ago and air marshals get priority, so the system assigned it to him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He knew it was the perfect vantage point from which to watch the watch.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: But the thief must have found out. And they couldn’t steal the watch with an air marshal sitting right there so they had to lure Ford out of first class.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Using a phone that, if traced, would lead them back to Ford’s girlfriend, who had a motive.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, that means the thief knows who’s on the plane. They had access to the manifest. Seat assignments. Ford’s personal life.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And passenger credit cards. This was an inside job. Aaron, who served you this drink? Because someone spiked it.

utterance.speaker: AARON
utterance.content: I can’t remember. But it’s usually her.

utterance.speaker: FARRAH
utterance.content: No. No, I did not drug anybody!

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, she couldn’t have. She was serving us over in aisle two.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well then, it was …

utterance.speaker: DEBBIE
utterance.content: Stay back.

utterance.speaker: FARRAH
utterance.content: Debbie? You?

utterance.speaker: DEBBIE
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: FARRAH
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: DEBBIE
utterance.content: Thirty years, Farrah. Thirty years of loyal service. I was finally ready to retire. So what does Oceanic do? They restructure and eliminate our pensions.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Debbie –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You don’t want to do this. Drop the gun.

utterance.speaker: DEBBIE
utterance.content: Do you have any idea what it’s like? Serving this little punk kid in first class every month? Hearing him brag about how much money he’s got strapped to his wrist? When I have nothing?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: So when you found out he was taking this flight again you decided to do something.

utterance.speaker: DEBBIE
utterance.content: I heard about that watch. How it was going to auctioned off. That’s 13 million. But nobody – nobody was supposed to get hurt. Right, I just – I just needed Ford to step away for, like, a minute. But when he saw Aaron was sleeping – – he knew. He tracked me down to the cargo hold …

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Debbie, what the airline did to you was unfair. But please, don’t make it worse. This isn’t who you are.

utterance.speaker: DEBBIE
utterance.content: It’s not. It’s not.

utterance.speaker: FARRAH
utterance.content: We’ll be landing soon. You can go ahead and retake your seat. With our apologies.

utterance.speaker: MARILYN
utterance.content: Thank you for believing in me, Mr. Castle. And for bringing Kyle’s killer to justice.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m – I’m very sorry for your loss.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mr. Haddad. Unfortunately, when the plane lands you’re going to be detained for travelling on a stolen passport. However, I had my friends in New York make some calls. If your story checks out the authorities here are going to allow you to travel to Syria to see your family before you face charges.

utterance.speaker: HADDAD
utterance.content: Thank you, Mr. Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Be safe.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And you. I am very proud of the way you handled yourself today. What you said to Debbie, it was … very brave.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Thanks. You know, I think I’m going to postpone my pub date.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You are?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I thought you said you didn’t want to be attached at the hip?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah, well, after what happened today I kinda do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Me too.

utterance.speaker: CAPTAIN EDMUNDS
utterance.content: Folks, this is your captain. We’re starting our final descent into London Heathrow. Please take your seats. We’ll have you on the ground shortly.
